All of our bases and mix-ins are made in-house with a secret blend of sugars and stabilizers, steeped with real ingredients for 18-24 hours using a modified gelato process. Then slowly incorporate liquid nitrogen to freeze the base at -300°F, creating exceptionally small ice crystals for an extraordinarily smooth, silky mouthfeel. After hardening overnight in our deep freezes, our ice cream transitions from a soft-serve consistency to the classic, chewy texture New England is known for.

Open June - October, Waltham Fields Community Farm (WFCF) is a nonprofit agricultural organization that sustainably stewards agricultural land, providing its harvests and educational programming to local and Greater Boston communities. WFCF’s agricultural operations include a Community Supported Agriculture (CSA) program, Barn Store, and education and volunteering programs. 

Subsidized CSA shares are available. For details, go to https://communityfarms.org/csa/csa-overview.
